acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials found in collection; provenance is unknown. The accession number associated with this collection is 1950.107.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. Materials are in the order in which they were received from the donor.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Paul Buhle (b. 1944), is an historian of the American Left, and was the founding editor of the journal Radical America (1967–1999), and founder of Cultural Correspondence (1977–83), a journal of popular culture studies, and a founder and director of the Oral History of the American Left archive at New York University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Paul Buhle Collection on Social Humor; TAM 264; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of correspondence that contains discussion of publishing humor material in Cultural Correspondence, plans to start a new mass circulation humor magazine, and the creation of an international radical humor movement. The collection also contains a number of radical humor publications from around the country.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright (and related rights to publicity and privacy) to materials in this collection created by Paul Buhle was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.
